title: We’ll not relent in prayers for Buhari – Islamic cleric
text:
Home » News » We’ll not relent in prayers for Buhari – Islamic cleric We’ll not relent in prayers for Buhari – Islamic cleric On 7:27 pm In News by adekunle Comments 
By Bashir Bello KATSINA – A Katsina based Islamic cleric, Imam Sheikh Suleiman Rahma on Friday said it will not stop and relent in it prayers for President Muhammadu Buhari. 
The Islamic cleric stated this while delivering his sermon during the two rakkat Jumaat, Friday prayers at Kandahar Mosque. PRESIDENT BUHARI RETURNS. 14C President Muhammadu Buhari Returns to abuja. 
Imam Rahma whose sermon centred around Prayer – Dua – as the weapon and sword of muslims, said it prayed for the President to get well and return safely and so they will not stop praying for him. 
According to him, “we are the most happiest people today, particularly that President Buhari is back safely. We thank Allah for the success and pray that You give him long live and good health. 
“We prayed that God gives him the strength and ability to lead the nation to the right path as well as his teams, advisers and others. 
“we have started experiencing light in the Nation. So we need to continue to pray for Mr. President for him to continue with the good work he has started. We should lift our hands up and pray to him. We should cry to him because He (Allah) said we should pray to Him and He will answer our prayers. 
“We pray for those who are sick in the hospital and at home that Allah grant them quick recovery from the sick bed,” Sheikh Rahma however prayed. adekunle
